France: Louis III dies, Carloman II becomes sole king of West Francia.
Germany: Louis the Younger died. His brother Charles the Fat inherited his kingdom. Siege of Asselt: The Viking leader Godfrid, Duke of Frisia was besieged in his camp in the valley of the Meuse by East Frankish forces. After converting to Christianity he was granted the Kennemerland as a vassal of Charles the Fat. Wilhelminer War: The Wilhelminers rebelled against Aribo of Austria, the margrave of the East Frankish March of Pannonia. Wilhelminer War: The Wilhelminers paid homage to Arnulf of Carinthia in exchange for his support against Aribo. Frankish-Moravian War: Svatopluk I of Moravia, the king of Great Moravia, intervened in Pannonia on the side of Aribo.
Russia: Oleg of Novgorod conquered Kiev and moved the capital there.
Spain: First Battle of Cellorigo: Vela Jiménez, count of the Asturian county of Álava, repelled an attempted conquest by the Emirate of Córdoba of an important mountain pass at Cellorigo. Fortún Garcés was returned to rule in Navarre.
